Summary: Bullshit but good. The design of some of the levels is absolutely awful, and there are plenty of softlocks too. But the game is still pretty fun, but as with all games, wait for a sale.

I finally played and beat this game instead of just playing mods or just messing around. ~23 years after first playing it, Team Fortress Classic, Counter Strike, Day of Defeat, etc. Half Life was pretty good - lots of nostalgia, cool soundtrack, fairly linear and sometimes tedious but still an experience I'm glad I took part in. It's about 12 hours of gameplay including getting lost and consulting walkthroughs.

Now quick disclaimer, obviously this is an older game and its age is definitely showing. However, that doesn't mean there's a lack of fun to be had. The gun play was pretty fun. The maps also have this special charm to them. It takes you through a good handful of environments that all feel unique. The story line is pretty interesting as well,

What else can i really say other than "It's Half-Life, bro, you won't regret it"?
But for real, it's a great game and deserves every award it got <3

A game that does shows its age in a lot of parts. Graphics are not amazing, but they have their charm and I'm sure they were very cutting edge when this game released back in 1998. Movement can feel great and then feel not so great. It's a mixed bag. Some of the design in this game can also prove to be frustrating. I had to turn on god mode a few times due to not having enough health and some parts being near impossible to go through without taking damage. Plus that final level is a just a barrage of enemies which proves very difficult, even on easier difficulties. I'm sure some of this was due to me being bad, but there were a lot of parts were enemy design and placement felt cheap.

However, this game has a lot of things that have aged very well. The music is fantastic and is always used very appropriately. There are also so many really cool set pieces. Every area I went through was not only well designed (level wise) but was also super memorable. The puzzles were also very well done and I was able to figure them out without the game ever spelling it out for you. The story is also simplistic, but very interesting and always had me intrigued. Plus it helps that the character of The G-Man is not only very menacing but is like the only one in the game to have decent voice acting. Lastly, the gun play still feels so rewarding and fun to play with a lot of cool weapons at your hands. 

So, it's definitely NOT a perfect game. But if you give the game a shot, I'm sure you will find a lot to love here.

By todays standards, Half Life may not look like much but it was revolutionary for its time. The majority of the game is still fantastic to this day, but unfortunately the final few chapters are terrible and rely on slippery first person platforming and low gravity. At least that section of the game is fairly short though.
I still play this through at least once a year, and if you haven't got around to playing it yet, why haven't you?
